title: Documentation 🐛 w.r.t. weighting loss fncs
body_html:
In nn.loss.py class weight is specified as type Tensor.

pytorch/torch/nn/modules/loss.py

Lines 99 to 100 in cd5275e

weight (Tensor, optional): a manual rescaling weight given to each
class. If given, has to be a Tensor of size "nclasses"

If a Tensor is passed as weight it is ignored though (think this changed in 0.2.0). Should be of type Variable as correctly documented deeper in implementation:

pytorch/torch/nn/functional.py

Lines 656 to 657 in cd5275e

weight (Variable, optional): a manual rescaling weight given to each
class. If given, has to be a Variable of size "nclasses"
body_text:
In nn.loss.py class weight is specified as type Tensor.

  
    
      pytorch/torch/nn/modules/loss.py
    
    
        Lines 99 to 100
      in
      cd5275e
    
    
    
    

        
          
                   weight (Tensor, optional): a manual rescaling weight given to each 
        

        
          
                      class. If given, has to be a Tensor of size "nclasses" 
        
    
  


If a Tensor is passed as weight it is ignored though (think this changed in 0.2.0). Should be of type Variable as correctly documented deeper in implementation:

  
    
      pytorch/torch/nn/functional.py
    
    
        Lines 656 to 657

                   weight (Variable, optional): a manual rescaling weight given to each 
        

        
          
                       class. If given, has to be a Variable of size "nclasses"
body:
In `nn.loss.py` class `weight` is specified as type `Tensor`.
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/cd5275e79f41e8d461ce7ccde7c0201fcced7e24/torch/nn/modules/loss.py#L99-L100

If a `Tensor` is passed as `weight` it is ignored though (think this changed in 0.2.0). Should be of type `Variable` as correctly documented deeper in implementation:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/cd5275e79f41e8d461ce7ccde7c0201fcced7e24/torch/nn/functional.py#L656-L657
